document_title: Pubic lice: Causes, signs, treatment, prevention
subsection_content:
Pubic lice are small insects that live on human pubic hair
Pubic lice is a disease that causes itching in the private area or the area around the genitals. Patients have an itchy feeling that lasts about 5 days after being infected with pubic lice, this feeling will be more intense at night. (first)
Pubic lice are small insects that live on the pubic hair (hair area around the genitals) of humans. Pubic lice are classified as parasites because they suck human blood to survive.
Pubic lice are different from pubic lice (lice) that exist in hair or on the human body. However, this type of lice can appear on other parts of the body that have coarse hair, including:
Armpit.; Beard, mustache or facial hair.; Chest.; Eyebrows and eyelashes (more common in children).
